questions.name: Bulbasaur
questions.hint: This Pokémon can be seen napping in bright sunlight. There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun's rays, the seed grows progressively larger.

questions.name: Charmander
questions.hint: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when it is enjoying itself. If the Pokémon becomes enraged, the flame burns fiercely.

questions.name: Squirtle
questions.hint: This Pokémon's shell is not merely used for protection. The shell's rounded shape and the grooves on its surface help minimize resistance in water, enabling this Pokémon to swim at high speeds.

questions.name: Pikachu
questions.hint: Whenever this Pokémon comes across something new, it blasts it with a jolt of electricity. If you come across a blackened berry, it's evidence that this Pokémon mistook the intensity of its charge.

questions.name: Clefairy
questions.hint: On every night of a full moon, groups of this Pokémon come out to play. When dawn arrives, the tired Pokémon return to their quiet mountain retreats and go to sleep nestled up against each other.

questions.name: Jigglypuff
questions.hint: This Pokémon's vocal cords can freely adjust the wavelength of its voice. This Pokémon uses this ability to sing at precisely the right wavelength to make its foes most drowsy.

questions.name: Meowth
questions.hint: This Pokémon withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak about without making any incriminating footsteps. For some reason, this Pokémon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.

questions.name: Electabuzz
questions.hint: When a storm arrives, gangs of this Pokémon compete with each other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning bolts. Some towns use this Pokémon in place of lightning rods.

questions.name: Gyarados
questions.hint: When evolving into this Pokémon, its brain cells undergo a structural transformation. It is said that this transformation is to blame for this Pokémon's wildly violent nature.

questions.name: Lapras
questions.hint: People have driven this Pokémon almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, this Pokémon is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.

questions.name: Eevee
questions.hint: This Pokémon has an unstable genetic makeup that suddenly mutates due to the environment in which it lives. Radiation from various stones causes this Pokémon to evolve.

questions.name: Gengar
questions.hint: Sometimes, on a dark night, your shadow thrown by a streetlight will suddenly and startlingly overtake you. It is actually this Pokémon running past you, pretending to be your shadow.

questions.name: Magmar
questions.hint: In battle, this Pokémon blows out intensely hot flames from all over its body to intimidate its opponent. This Pokémon's fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in its surroundings.

questions.name: Snorlax
questions.hint: Its typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile Pokémon that there are children who use its expansive belly as a place to play.

questions.name: Articuno
questions.hint: A legendary bird Pokémon that can control ice. The flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said that when this Pokémon flies, snow will fall.

questions.name: Zapdos
questions.hint: A legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds. It gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.

questions.name: Moltres
questions.hint: A legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control fire. If it is injured, it is said to dip its body in the molten magma of a volcano to burn and heal itself.

questions.name: Mewtwo
questions.hint: This Pokémon was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans created its body, they failed to endow it with a compassionate heart.

questions.name: Mew
questions.hint: This Pokémon is said to possess the genetic composition of all other Pokémon. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.

questions.name: Chikorita
questions.hint: In battle, this Pokémon waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.

questions.name: Cyndaquil
questions.hint: This Pokémon protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.

questions.name: Totodile
questions.hint: Despite the smallness of its body, this Pokémon's jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.

questions.name: Pichu
questions.hint: This Pokémon charges itself with electricity more easily on days with thunderclouds or when the air is very dry. You can hear the crackling of static electricity coming off of it.

questions.name: Togepi
questions.hint: As its energy, this Pokémon uses the positive emotions of compassion and pleasure exuded by people and Pokémon. It stores up feelings of happiness inside its shell, then shares them with others.

questions.name: Marill
questions.hint: This Pokémon's oil-filled tail acts much like a life preserver. If you see just its tail bobbing on the water's surface, it's a sure indication that this Pokémon is diving beneath the water to feed on aquatic plants.

questions.name: Wobbuffet
questions.hint: If two or more of this Pokémon meet, they will turn competitive and try to outdo each other's endurance. However, they may try to see which one can endure the longest without food.

questions.name: Snubbull
questions.hint: By baring its fangs and making a scary face, this Pokémon sends smaller Pokémon scurrying away in terror. However, it seems a little sad at making its foes flee.

questions.name: Heracross
questions.hint: This Pokémon charges in a straight line at its foe, slips beneath the foe's grasp, and then scoops up and hurls the opponent with its mighty horn. It even has enough power to topple a massive tree.

questions.name: Lugia
questions.hint: This Pokémon's wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, it chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.

questions.name: Ho-oh
questions.hint: This Pokémon's feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. It is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.
